On 6/12/06, J. B. Rainsberger <jbrains@...> wrote:
>
>
> I love you,=
 Cedric, like a brother /and/ I think this rant is the single
> sloppiest t=
hing you've ever written. I don't have the energy to list all
> the problem=
s with it, but I will point out that someone on this list
> wrote about 300=
 pages on bringing Java legacy code under test, including
> dozens of examp=
les that cover the core of a J2EE application. What more

I=
 never said it was not possible, I was just complaining about the way Agile=

developers try to convince their audience.

As for the "sloppiest" part, a=
bout forty people have commented on my post so
far, and a lot of them with =
experiences confirming my observations.  Maybe
you find it sloppy, but I su=
ggest you look beyond the form, because there
are obviously some real point=
s in there...
